title: Is a positive statement a fact or an opinion? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is a positive statement a fact or an opinion? In grammar, it is simply the opposite of a negative statement, or it is not a question or exclamation. In meaning, a positive statement can be a fact or an opinion or both. Example: I think donuts are great. The example is both an opinion (mine) and a fact (I said it).
A positive statement is a claim that something exists. It represents an opinion that may be factual (and is in the opinion of the speaker).
